metadata.name: Time Machine Backup Disabled Via Tmutil - MacOS
metadata.comment: Detects disabling of Time Machine (Apple's automated backup utility software) via the native macOS backup utility "tmutil". An attacker can use this to prevent backups from occurring.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/tmutil')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('tmutil')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('disable')))

output.summary: Detects disabling of Time Machine (Apple's automated backup utility software) via the native macOS backup utility "tmutil". An attacker can use this to prevent backups from occurring.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate administrator activity References: https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/master/atomics/T1490/T1490.md#atomic-test-12---disable-time-machine, https://www.loobins.io/binaries/tmutil/
